Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)

= a bird with a blue gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering
= state of being silent
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
the meaning of this word is uncertain and even its etymology cannot be easily established

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= pattern of actions by which humans subject individuals or entire communities to cruelty and/or injustice
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= action by which humans or deities initiate a confrontation with (other) humans
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans
= pattern of actions by which humans subject individuals or entire communities to cruelty and/or injustice
= person with whom one is in conflict
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= action by which humans or deities initiate a confrontation with (other) humans

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= causative action by which human try to do damage to the activities of others
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= process by which humans plan aggression or war against other humans

Node.gloss: to lurk|to lie in wait|to ambush
Node.definition: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person
= action by which humans move forward by putting one leg in front of the other
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: to bring down; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lose their power or social status
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to count; hence: = action by which a deity is well aware of a certain event
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine or milk
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which humans stop moving into a certain direction and start moving back into the direction they came from
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity
literally: thanksgiving; hence: = a sacrifice offered as a token of thankfulness
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which humans or animals stop living
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= action by which someone strikes one's foot against something while walking or running, causing this person to stagger or fall; ≈ possibly a euphemism for death
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
